Très bon jeu avec un bon potentiel, qui malheureusement est souvent gâché par des joueurs toxic (camp, tunnel, slug, insultes, remarques sexistes) et ce comportement semble être encouragé par les modérateurs. En effet, un tueur joue toxic, tu quitte c'est toi qui prend une sanction. alors que lui peut continuer sans peine a pourrir les games des autres. Du coups c'est la foire aux insultes et aux remarques sexistes (En effet, ce jour un mec m'a dit que ma place était dans la cuisine). Hélas, ce comportement nuis à la qualité de jeu et surtout au plaisir des autres joueurs. Le principe du jeu est pas mal : 
                                 - on est bien mis dans l'ambiance avec une musique adapté, 
                                 - de nombreux personnages avec chacun leurs caractéristiques,
                                 - de belles map qui font des petits clins d’œil à certains films/séries d'horreurs 
                                 - et enfin de beaux graphismes qui permettent une certaine immersion.

RUN WHILE YOU CAN!! But, in all honesty I have 80 hours on this game on PC and almost 150 hours on xbox. I've enjoyed this game more than almost any other game I have played. Though sometimes a bit frustrating the game always hooks me back in the next day. The game is almost perfect the balancing is just a bit strange. The worst part of this game by far is the community; they are toxic and mean for almost no reason but other than that this game is so much fun! I would highly recommend this game to anyone and I know they will have a good time once they add some good time and practice. -A Laurie Strode main.

I had written a review before about this game and why I didn't recommend it, but I deleted it because I had decided to take a different approach to playing. I had begun to enjoy it, and while I still didn't want to recommend it to others, I wanted to give it a better shot.

Having put another 100 hours into the game, I can confidently say that unless things change and the devs get their heads right and listen to the community more, I will not be returning to DBD. I have uninstalled and will not be reinstalling until enough about the game changes to encourage me to come back.

The dev team have chosen the worst possible decisions to approach speaking with their community. They keep a stranglehold on the streamers by demanding a 'certain kind' of interaction. They do nothing about hacks. They do nothing about improving the matchmaking. They do nothing about fixing broken metas that are unfun to play WITH or AGAINST. They do nothing to create an environment for players to be ALLOWED to enjoy the game.

When you mention something about it to the devs, they give no concrete answers about it. When streamers mention the game needs a meta change, they give out bloodpoints instead of making the game fun to play. Killers come out unbalanced, unplayable, or unfun to play as or against. Perks get uncontrollably power-scaled or power-creeped into very specific angles that make dealing with any of it impossible to enjoy.

Why has the game been around THIS long and not had ANY engine changes? Why does BHVR put out beta builds when they refuse to listen to community feedback? People have been talking about the DS/BT/DH/UB meta being stale for... What? Two years now? Why have they done NOTHING about that?

But if you dare question a lame analogy or poor decision on a public forum or stream, you get accused of 'harassment'? If you complain about MMR, you get accused of being an entitled [role]. I'm writing this not because I don't WANT to like DBD. I'm writing this because I've given the community and Devs every chance I can to make the right decisions, but they refuse.

I'm done. I'll watch Otz, Scott, and the others to keep tabs on the game until I see an improvement. Until then? I won't be coming back. I could devote this time better with learning guitar again, or playing Elden Ring, or finishing one of the 12 games I've been meaning to finish but haven't yet.

I've played Dead by Daylight since the Shape came out. While I only have 400 hours on PC, I have around 180 days of playtime on XBOX. This game is becoming worse and worse the older it gets. The community for DBD is extremely toxic. The SBMM (skill-based matchmaking) is the worst idea DBD has ever had. Killer and Survivor perks take a ridiculous amount of time to grind for, only 4-6 perks are actually useful for both sides, solo queue as a survivor is actually the worst experience anyone could have, and the bugs this game consistently has are why this game is undeserving of being recommended to anyone. I love this game, but it's in a very bad state and until that changes I won't be recommending it to anyone.

Buen multi en general es bastante adictivo y las mecánicas de cada killer son interesantes, se torna bastante aburrido jugar de survi si no juegan con amigos (a humillar al killer la mayoría de las veces), si tengo problema con las premades. Buen asimétrico en general, tan asimétrico que está desbalanceado de un bando. Comunidad de la más toxica espera T-bag por matar, por no dejarte ganar, por regalar trampilla, por jugar mal, por jugar en general, es más ,probablemente reciba T-bag por reseñar.

The satisfaction you get from playing and winning doesn't match the anger I get from playing and losing. I play games to have fun, not to break my computer out of frustration. If you like a challenge, get this game. If you want to have fun, I wouldn't recommend this game.

Can be so much fun if it didnt have such horrible optimization *without* any safety points for d/c due to "unexpected error, validate files" during a game. I literally played an entire game, opened the exit gate, and on my way running out it crashed. Lost the pip, lost the bloodpoints. Cool. Start it up again after a (just incase) restart computer, throw in party streamer to make up for the lost points and the moment the game starts I get on a gen and get "ERROR: Validate files" and I have to exit the match to do it. 

So now Im losing the items, the points, and a rank with a match queue time because the game doesnt let me reconnect due to a forced d/c. There needs to be some kind of protection in place for this. Bare minimum let me reconnect. So frustrating.

Anyways, i recommend the game for when you want to hate everything about something but keep playing it because you hate yourself and think you low key deserve it. :)
